channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Homological dimensions of algebras of analytic functionals and their completions
item.description: arXiv:2510.26249v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that the main homological dimensions of the algebra of analytic functionals on a connected complex Lie group, as well as some of its completions, coincide with the dimension of the simply connected solvable factor in the canonical decomposition of the linearization of this group. Thus, the possible nontriviality of a linearly complex reductive factor does not affect the homological properties of the algebras under consideration.
item.dc:creator: Oleg Aristov

item.title: Affineness and reconstruction in complex-periodic geometry
item.description: arXiv:2510.26711v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Working in a generic derived algebro-geometric context, we lay the foundations for the general study of affineness and local descendability. When applied to $\mathbf{E}_\infty$ rings equipped with the fpqc topology, these foundations give an $\infty$-category of spectral stacks, a viable functor-of-points alternative to Lurie's approach to nonconnective spectral algebraic geometry. Specializing further to spectral stacks over the moduli stack of oriented formal groups, we use chromatic homotopy theory to obtain a large class of $0$-affine stacks, generalizing Mathew--Meier's famous $0$-affineness result. We introduce a spectral refinement of Hopkins' stack construction of an $\mathbf{E}_\infty$ ring, and study when it provides an inverse to the global sections of a spectral stack. We use this to show that a large class of stacks, which we call reconstructible, are naturally determined by their global sections, including moduli stacks of oriented formal groups of bounded height and the moduli stack of oriented elliptic curves.
item.dc:creator: William Balderrama, Jack Morgan Davies, Sil Linskens

item.title: Loop homology of moment-angle complexes in the flag case
item.description: arXiv:2403.18450v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We develop a general homological approach to presentations of connected graded associative algebras, and apply it to the loop homology of moment-angle complexes $Z_K$ that correspond to flag simplicial complexes $K$. For arbitrary coefficient ring, we describe generators of the Pontryagin algebra $H_*(\Omega Z_K)$ and defining relations between them. We prove that such moment-angle complexes are coformal over $\mathbb{Q},$ give a necessary condition for rational formality, and compute their homotopy groups in terms of homotopy groups of spheres.
item.dc:creator: Fedor Vylegzhanin

item.title: Enveloping operads and applications
item.description: arXiv:2407.18190v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: This work addresses the homotopical analysis of enveloping operads in a general cofibrantly generated symmetric monoidal model category. We show the potential of this analysis by obtaining, in a uniform way, several central results regarding the homotopy theory of operadic algebras.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra, Volume 229, Issue 12, December 2025, 108119
item.dc:creator: Victor Carmona
